clinical_study.brief_title: Probiotics in Elderly Patients With Medical Conditions
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Efficacy of Probiotics in Treating Constipation in Elderly Patients With Multiple Chronic Co-morbidities: a Randomized Control Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Study of efficacy of probiotic in older patients with multiple co-morbidites and constipation

detailed_description.textblock:
Background and aims:
Probiotics are known to have a beneficial effect on the management of constipation. Thus, the current study objective was to evaluate the impact of a microbial cell preparation (MCP) (Hexbio®; comprising Bifidobacterium and Lactobacillus strains) on stool frequency, consistency, and constipation-related symptoms in elderly patients with multiple chronic medical conditions.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The subjects received either the probiotics or a placebo.
study_design_info.masking_description: Both investigators and patients were unaware of the assignment and were blinded to the labelling process performed by the sample supplier. The patients were randomly allocated to one of two groups; those who received sample labelled A or B. Emergency code break were kept at the manufacturing factory and no code break was needed throughout the trial duration. Both the MCP and placebo were manufactured and supplied by B-Crobes Laboratory Sdn. Bhd. as powder in identical sachets and labelled as A and B. Investigators have no contact with the manufacturing staffs at any point during the trial process. Following data analysis, unblinding was performed to complete the study process.

primary_outcome.description: numerical scale 0-100 used, 0= nil (worst), 100= good, medium score was used for data interpratation
The Bristol Stool scale was used, scale type 1 to 7, type 1 = hard stool and type 7=entirely liquid stool, medium score was used for data intepretation

secondary_outcome.measure: patients' perceptions of an improvement in their constipation-related symptoms 1
secondary_outcome.description: straining: likert score of 0 to 10 was used, 0=no straining, 10= worst straining

secondary_outcome.measure: patients' perceptions of an improvement in their constipation-related symptoms 2
secondary_outcome.description: sensation of incomplete evacuation: likert score of 0 to 10 was used, 0= total incomplete evacuation, 10=complete evacuation

secondary_outcome.measure: patients' perceptions of an improvement in their constipation-related symptoms 3
secondary_outcome.description: sensation of ano-rectal obstruction/blockage: likert score of 0 to 10 was used, 0=complete obstruction, 10= complete relieved

secondary_outcome.measure: patients' perceptions of an improvement in their constipation-related symptoms 4
secondary_outcome.description: Need of manual evacuation to aid defeacation: likert score of 0 to 10 was used, 0=no evacuation needed, 10=total evacuation needed

arm_group.description: placebo were manufactured and supplied by B-Crobes Laboratory Sdn. Bhd. as powder in identical sachets with active comparator and labelled as A

The treatment sample is labelled as B.This is an orange-flavoured, granulated microbial cell preparation containing 30 billion colony forming units (cfu) of Lactobacilli and Bifidobacteria strains: Lactobacillus acidophilus BCMC® 12130, Lactobacillus casei BCMC® 12313, Lactobacillus lactis BCMC® 12451, Bifidobacterium bifidum BCMC® 02290, Bifidobacterium infantis BCMC®02129, Bifidobacterium longum BCMC® 02120. The placebo sample was similar in appearance and taste, but contained no microbial cells.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
-clinical diagnosis of constipation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Parkinson's disease,
- spinal cord lesions
- post radiation strictures
- on calcium supplements of greater than 1,500 mg per day
- immune-deficiency
- critical illness
